terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.about-mereo.content1: Mereo is an experience and social platform that provides fans with various perks at all stages of an event. Mereo converges the offline and online experience of being a part of the fan community through our social platform and proprietary events.
terms.about-mereo.subcontent1: Ticketing: Manage event operations, sales & verification and distribution for offline & online events.
terms.about-mereo.subcontent2: Fan engagement: Get fans to engagement with the artist before and after the event.
terms.about-mereo.subcontent3: Rewards: Based on fan's engagement allow the artist to reward their top fans
terms.about-mereo.content3: Any works and associated Intellectual Property (IP) developed by Mereo is owned by Mereo. NFTs ownership grants the owner a perpetual licence granted by Mereo. Any resources available to Mereo are not beneficially received or owned by any person whilst those resources are contained in the Mereo wallet address, and members have no rights to an in-specie distribution of those resources or the proceeds from any sale of those resources during the life of Mereo or upon winding up of the Mereo.
terms.about-mereo.content4: Mereo comprises of the distributed ledger technology (DLT) contracts outlined in Clause 2, each of which are published under MIT License where Mereo is neither the author or copyright holder of the Software (as that term is defined under the MIT License) or works referenced by Software for which the IP is owned
terms.mereo-nft.subcontent1: The contract that is utilised for the creation and distribution of NFT Tickets upon purchase.
terms.mereo-nft.subcontent2: Mereo Ticketing Contract: to be advised.

terms.risks.content1: <bold>General:</bold> All activities involving tokens and NFTs carry risk. The appropriate level of risk for you may be dependent on your circumstances. Some key risks are outlined below:
terms.risks.subcontent1: <bold>Risk of decline in value of tokens:</bold> Mereo cannot guarantee the value of Mereo Tokens and NFTs at any time.
terms.risks.subcontent2: <bold>Market integrity risk:</bold> Mereo NFTs are capable of being freely traded but Mereo does not have the power to intervene. Accordingly, the price of Mereo NFTs will be subject to external market influence. The value of Mereo Tokens and NFTs will fluctuate and may fluctuate extremely. Their value may reduce to zero.
terms.risks.subcontent3: <bold>Financial risk:</bold> Mereo does not guarantee its ability to maintain a strong enough treasury to continue operations. There is a risk that the Mereo is not sufficiently responsive to changes in the industry, or cannot raise sufficient capital to continue operations.
terms.risks.subcontent4: <bold>Operational risk:</bold> Including, but not limited to, technology risk (i.e. DLTcontract vulnerabilities), reputational risk, fraud, compliance, outsourcing, business continuity planning, and legal risk.
terms.risks.subcontent5: <bold>Technology risk:</bold> Token and NFT activities carry the risks of interacting with Third-party Extensions and Third-party Platforms to participate in Mereo Activities. There is a risk that any Mereo Tokens and NFTs you acquire while participating with Mereo Activities could be stolen or exploited by a DLT contract vulnerability. You should also be wary of scams designed to convince you to sell or lend your Mereo NFTs, and should only engage with the Mereo and Mereo Activities in accordance with these Terms.
terms.risks.subcontent6: <bold>DLT contract risk:</bold> While the Mereo has taken steps to ensure the DLT contracts are safe and secure, there may be vulnerabilities in the suite of DLT contracts. These vulnerabilities could result in the loss of tokens other than just your Mereo Tokens, and could be related to other attacks to obtain your personal and sensitive information.
terms.risks.subcontent7: <bold>Custody risk:</bold> Mereo NFTs are tokens that are generally held in a self-hosted digital wallet or hardware wallet. Mereo NFTs rely on cryptography and technology such as blockchain for security and other features. There is no central authority for blockchain systems that collect identity information or that can recover lost or stolen tokens or private keys.
terms.risks.subcontent8: <bold>Regulatory risk:</bold> The legal and tax characterisation of Mereo and of NFT activities is uncertain and regulatory and policy efforts are evolving. It is your responsibility to ensure that your access and participation in Mereo Activities is lawful.
terms.risks.subcontent9: <bold>Tax treatment & policy environment:</bold> The tax treatment of token activities is uncertain. Tax authorities around the world are attempting to understand the technology, issue guidance to the public and consult on relevant necessary tax reform. The application of traditional tax principles to novel technology and NFT activities remains largely untested in court.
terms.risks.subcontent10: <bold>Phishing risk:</bold> Scammers may create phishing websites which pretend to be Mereo or involved in Mereo Activities. You are responsible for carefully checking that you are accessing the correct domain and application.

Both parties agree to meet and confer personally, by telephone, or by videoconference (hereinafter “Conference”) to discuss the dispute and attempt in good faith to reach a mutually beneficial outcome that avoids the expenses of arbitration or, where applicable, litigation. If you are represented by counsel, your counsel may participate in the Conference as well, but you agree to fully participate in the Conference. Likewise, if Mereo is represented by counsel, its counsel may participate in the Conference as well, but  Mereo agrees to have a company representative fully participate in the Conference. The statute of limitations and any filing fee deadlines shall be tolled while the parties engage in the informal dispute resolution process and Conference required by this paragraph. If the parties do not reach agreement to resolve the dispute within thirty days after initiation of this dispute resolution process, either party may commence arbitration, file an action in small claims court, or file a claim for injunctive or equitable relief in a court of proper jurisdiction for matters relating to intellectual property infringement, if the claims qualify.
terms.arbitration.content3.subcontent1: Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of, relating to, or in connection with the your use of or participation in the Interface, the Mereo Activities, the Content, or in connection with these Terms, including disputes arising from your purchase from us of digital or physical goods, or concerning the interpretation, violation, invalidity, non-performance, or termination of these Terms, or whether the claims asserted are arbitrable shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the American Arbitration Association’s Rules, which rules are deemed to be incorporated in this clause. The seat of the arbitration shall be in Dubai or Singapore, and determined at our sole discretion. The Tribunal shall consist of one arbitrator. The language of the arbitration shall be English. The Tribunal shall have the power to rule on any challenge to its own jurisdiction or to the validity or enforceability of any portion of the agreement to arbitrate.
terms.arbitration.content4.subcontent1: The arbitrator shall have exclusive authority to
terms.arbitration.content4.subcontent1.c: determine the scope and enforceability of this Arbitration Agreement and;

resolve any dispute related to the interpretation, applicability, enforceability, or formation of this Arbitration Agreement including, but not limited to, any claim that all or any part of this Arbitration Agreement is void or voidable. The arbitration will decide the rights and liabilities, if any, of you and Mereo. The arbitration proceeding will not be consolidated with any other matters or joined with any other cases or parties. The arbitrator shall have the authority to grant motions dispositive of all or part of any claim. The arbitrator shall have the authority to award monetary damages and to grant any non-monetary remedy or relief available to an individual under applicable law, the arbitral forum’s rules, and these Terms. The arbitrator shall issue a written award and statement of decision describing the essential findings and conclusions on which the award is based, including the calculation of any damages awarded. The arbitrator has the same authority to award relief on an individual basis that a judge in a court of law would have. The award of the arbitrator is final and binding upon you and us.
terms.arbitration.content5.subcontent1: YOU AND MEREO HEREBY WAIVE ANY CONSTITUTIONAL AND STATUTORY RIGHTS TO SUE IN COURT AND HAVE A TRIAL IN FRONT OF A JUDGE OR A JURY.
terms.arbitration.content5.subcontent2: You and Mereo are instead electing that all claims and disputes shall be resolved by arbitration under this Arbitration Agreement. An arbitrator can award on an individual basis the same damages and relief as a court and must follow these Terms as a court would. However, there is no judge or jury in arbitration, and court review of an arbitration award is subject to very limited review.
terms.arbitration.content6: Waiver of Class Actions and Class Arbitrations.
terms.arbitration.content6.subcontent1: ALL CLAIMS AND DISPUTES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THIS ARBITRATION AGREEMENT MUST BE ARBITRATED ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS AND NOT ON A REPRESENTATIVE (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, PAGA) OR COLLECTIVE CLASS BASIS. ONLY INDIVIDUAL RELIEF IS AVAILABLE, AND CLAIMS OF MORE THAN ONE USER, PERSON, OR ENTITY CANNOT BE ARBITRATED OR CONSOLIDATED WITH THOSE OF ANY OTHER USER, PERSON, OR ENTITY.
terms.arbitration.content6.subcontent2: Accordingly, under the arbitration procedures outlined in this section, an arbitrator shall not combine or consolidate more than one party’s claims without the written consent of all affected parties to an arbitration proceeding. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, you and Mereo agree that no dispute shall proceed by way of class arbitration without the written consent of all affected parties. If a decision is issued stating that applicable law precludes enforcement of any part of this subsection’s limitations as to a given claim for relief, then that claim must be severed from the arbitration and brought in the jurisdiction of Hong Kong. All other claims shall be arbitrated.
terms.arbitration.content7.subcontent1: Except as provided in this Section, if any part or parts of this Arbitration Agreement are found under the law to be invalid or unenforceable, then such specific part or parts shall be of no force and effect and shall be severed and the remainder of the Arbitration Agreement shall continue in full force and effect.
terms.arbitration.content8: Nothing in this clause shall affect the statutory rights you have as a consumer, under the consumer law relevant and applicable to you.
terms.arbitration.content9: Limitation on time to file claims.
terms.arbitration.content9.subcontent1: Except where we may not lawfully impose a bar to action, any cause of action or claim you may have arising out of or relating to these terms or your use of the Interface or Mereo Activities MUST BE COMMENCED WITHIN ONE YEAR AFTER THE CAUSE OF ACTION ACCRUES OR OTHERWISE SUCH CAUSE OR ACTION OR CLAIM IS PERMANENTLY BARRED.
terms.arbitration.content10.subcontent1: Any changes to the dispute resolution provisions in the course of updating these Terms will not apply to any disputes for which the parties have actual notice before the date the change is posted on the Website.
terms.leaderboards.content1: Mereo leaderboard calculations are conducted wholly on-chain with the utilisation of DLT contracts that automate the collection of scores from engagement in Mereo activities.
terms.leaderboards.content2: Mereo does not guarantee that additional rewards will be provided for those who obtain the highest rankings and reserves the right to change the rewards at any time.
terms.priority.content1: In the event of any inconsistency, these Terms must be interpreted in accordance with the following order of priority: the General Terms, then any other documents or information incorporated by reference to these Terms.
terms.interpreted: Terms to be interpreted in accordance with clear commercial purposes
terms.interpreted.content1: These Terms are to be interpreted in accordance with its clear commercial purposes. These Terms are not to be read literally if that would produce a result clearly contrary to those purposes.
terms.severability.content1: Each provision of these Terms is individually severable. If a clause or part of a clause of these Terms can be read in a way that makes it illegal, unenforceable or invalid, but can also be read in a way that makes it legal, enforceable and valid, it must be read in the latter way. If any clause or part of a clause is illegal, unenforceable or invalid, that clause or part is to be treated as removed from this agreement, but the rest of this agreement is not affected.
policy.title: Privacy Policy
policy.1.1: In this privacy policy, “Mereo”, “us”, “we” or “our” means Mereo. We recognise the importance of protecting the privacy of Mereo Activities (as defined in the Terms and Conditions). The following privacy policy (Privacy Policy) is the way we handle information gathered about you from your use and interactions with Mereo Activities.
policy.1.2: PLEASE REVIEW THIS PRIVACY POLICY CAREFULLY. When you submit information to or through the use of Mereo Activities, you consent to the collection and processing of your information as described in this Privacy Policy. By partaking in Mereo Activities, you accept the terms of this Privacy Policy and the Terms and Conditions, confirm that you are at least eighteen (18) years old, or the legal age of capacity in your local jurisdiction, and consent to our collection, use, disclosure and retention of your information as described in this Privacy Policy.
policy.1.3: Your access to and use of the Services and the Interface are conditioned on Your acceptance of and compliance with this Privacy Policy.
policy.1.4: We may change our Privacy Policy from time to time by publishing changes to it on our website https://mereo.xyz. We encourage you to check our website periodically to ensure that you understand our current Privacy Policy.
policy.1.5: If you are a resident of the European Union, supplementary terms at 13 relating to the GDPR apply. Please read these additional terms carefully as they supplement the Privacy Policy and form part of our agreement with you.
policy.1.6: If you are a resident of California, supplementary terms at 14 relating to California apply. Please read these additional terms carefully as they supplement the Privacy Policy and form part of our agreement with you.
policy.2.1: <bold>Account</bold> means a unique account created for you to access Mereo Activities made available through the Interface, including products or services.
policy.2.2: <bold>Personal Information or Personal Data </bold> includes information and/or an opinion about an individual that is reasonably identifiable (i.e. name, age, gender, postcode, contact details, financial information, wallet address).
policy.2.3: <bold>Services</bold> means access of Mereo Activities including but not limited to:
policy.2.3.1: accessing the https://Mereo.io/ website for the purpose of purchasing, claiming and conducting Mereo activities;
policy.2.3.2: any other activity we make available through https://Mereo.io/ to you from time to time which requires the disclosure of your Personal Information or Personal Data.
policy.3: What personal information do we collect?
policy.3.1: The categories of Personal Information Mereo may collect and process depends on Mereo Activities you engage in, but may include:
policy.3.1.1: Personal details: name, gender, date of birth, nationality, tax residency;
policy.3.1.2: Contact details: email address, address, mobile number, social media account information;
policy.3.1.3: Interaction details: activity of your Account including products purchased and Services used;
policy.3.1.4: Payment details: bank and credit card details, and in certain circumstances blockchain addresses;
policy.3.1.5: Technical information: your device ID/IMEI, device type, geo-location, computer and connection information, page view statistics, traffic on our websites, ad data, IP addresses and web log information;
policy.3.1.6: Blockchain transactions: bids, offers, buys, sells, transfers, fees, withdrawals, claims, mints, burns, or other like transactions associated with your IP address, your Ethereum public address or any other wallet address on any other blockchain;
policy.3.1.7: Feedback information: information provided through different forms of feedback.
policy.4: How do we collect Personal Information?
policy.4.1: by you registering an Account via our Website or Interface;
policy.4.2: make a purchase or place an order using our Interface;
policy.4.3: communication with us through correspondence, chats, email, or when you share information with us from other social applications, Services or websites;
policy.4.4: make enquiries, report suspicious market activity or submit comments, bug reports, ideas, or other feedback about the Interface and our Services
policy.4.5: connect your compatible Ethereum wallet to Mereo Interface, sign a blockchain transaction or otherwise interact with the suite of smart contracts that comprise Mereo Activities from time to time;
policy.4.6: interact with our Interface, Services, Mereo Activities, content and advertising; or join a mailing list;
policy.4.7: participate in a competition, promotion or survey; and
policy.4.8: post a review, rating, comment, or other user-generated content on one of our websites or applications; and
policy.4.9: invest in Mereo or enquire as to a potential investment or donation to support Mereo
policy.4.10: We may also collect Personal Information when we receive your Personal Information from third parties who legally provide it to us.
policy.5: Why do we collect, use and disclose Personal Information?
policy.5.1: We may use the information we collect for any of the following purposes:
policy.5.1.1: enable you to access and use our Services and partake in Mereo Activities;
policy.5.1.2: to provide the Services and Mereo Activities to you and to improve the aforementioned;
policy.5.1.3: to operate, improve, and personalise the Services we offer, and to give each user a more consistent and personalised experience when interacting with us;
policy.5.1.4: for customer service, security, to detect fraud or illegal activities, and for archival and backup purposes in connection with the provision of the Service;
policy.5.1.5: to administer rewards, surveys, contests, or other promotional activities or events sponsored or managed by us or our business partners;
policy.5.1.6: to ensure compliance with our legal obligations, including those set forth by gaming regulators;
policy.5.1.7: to verify that you are at least 18 years old, or the required age of your local jurisdiction to engage in Mereo Activities;
policy.5.1.8: to verify that you reside in a jurisdiction in which we are providing the Service;
policy.5.1.9: to fulfil your requests, including those related to wagering; and
policy.6.1: We may share Your Personal Information to the entities We have described herein this Privacy Policy, including but not limited to
policy.6.2: Our employees and related bodies corporate of Mereo;
policy.6.5: Our existing or potential agents, business partners or partners;
policy.6.6: With Third Party Service Providers Performing Services on our behalf
policy.6.6.1: We share your personal information with our service providers to perform the functions for which we engage them.
policy.6.7.1: We share Your personal information with businesses, who, pursuant to an agreement, hold our wagering licence for the jurisdiction you reside in, to comply with regulatory requirements.
policy.6.8.1: including government agencies, regulatory bodies and law enforcement agencies, or as required, authorised or permitted by law.
policy.6.9.1: We may transfer or assign information, including Your personal information, in connection with a merger, acquisition, reorganisation, liquidation, change in control or other sale by or of us or any affiliated entity (in each case whether in whole or in part).
policy.6.10: Our sponsors or promoters of any competition that we conduct via our Services and Mereo Activities;
policy.6.11: Mereo does not share your personal information with third parties for those third parties’ direct marketing purposes.
policy.7.1: Mereo is responsible for designing Mereo systems with your security and privacy in mind. Mereo will take reasonable steps to protect your Personal Information from misuse, interference, and loss, as well as unauthorised access, modification, or disclosure. Mereo may appoint a Data Representative to own and control the data collected as a step to prevent unauthorised access to your Personal Information. Mereo Data Representative may use a combination of physical, administrative, personnel and technical measures (such as encryption protocols and software) to protect your Personal Information.
policy.8.1: Right to access: you have the right to obtain confirmation that your Personal Information is processed and obtain a copy;
policy.8.2: Right to rectify: you can request the rectification of Personal Information that is inaccurate or add to it;
policy.8.3: Right to delete: you can, in some cases, have your Personal Information deleted;
policy.8.4: Right to object: you can object, for reasons relating to your circumstances, to the processing of your Personal Information;
policy.8.5: Right to limit the processing: in certain circumstances, you have the right to limit the processing of your Personal Information;
policy.8.6: Right to portability: you can request to receive your Personal Information in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format, or, when this is possible, that we communicate your Personal Information on your behalf directly to another data controller;
policy.8.7: Right to withdraw your consent: for processing requiring your consent, you have the right to withdraw your consent at any time; however, exercising this right does not affect the lawfulness of any processing based on your prior consent;
policy.8.8: Right to set instructions relating to the use of your Personal Data post mortem: you have the right to define instructions relating to the retention,deletion, and communication of your Personal Information after your death
policy.8.9: Right to complain to the relevant data protection authority.
policy.9.1: Mereo may hold your Personal Information for as long as it is reasonably necessary to enable you to access and use our Services and interact with Mereo Activities. Mereo may retain your Personal Data wholly or partly for a longer or shorter period under applicable laws or any other lawful reason. The data retention periods may be altered from time to time based on regulatory or other changes.
policy.10.1.1: A cookie is a small file containing a string of characters that is sent to your computer when you visit a website or use an online service. When you visit the website or use the service again, the cookie allows that website or online service to recognize your browser or device. Cookies may store unique identifiers, user preferences and other information.
policy.10.2.1: We may use “session cookies” or “persistent cookies.” Session cookies are temporary and expire once you close your browser or once your session ends. Persistent cookies remain on your device for much longer or until you or your browser erase them. Persistent cookies have varying durations that are dependent on their expiration date.
policy.10.3.1: Cookies help us improve the Service by providing us with information about which parts of the Service are most popular, enabling us to analyse technical and navigational information about the Service, and helping us to detect and prevent fraud. We also use cookies and other data collection tools (such as web beacons and server logs) to help improve your experience with the Service. For example, we use Google Analytics to help analyse how users use the Service. These tools use cookies to collect standard Internet log information and visitor behaviour information in an anonymous form. The information generated by the cookie about your use of the Service (including IP address) is transmitted to our data collection tool service providers. This information is then used by us to evaluate visitors’ use of the Service and to compile statistical reports on website activity for Mereo.If you would like to opt-out from the use of your information by Google analytics, you may use Google’s analytics opt-out browser add-on designed for this purpose.
policy.10.4.1: Web browsers allow some control of most cookies through the browser settings. To find out more about cookies, including how to manage and delete cookies, visit www.allaboutcookies.org. Some web browsers provide settings that allow a user to reject cookies or to alert a user when a cookie is placed on the user’s computer, tablet or mobile device. Most mobile devices also offer settings to reject mobile device identifiers. Although users are not required to accept cookies or mobile device identifiers, blocking or rejecting them may prevent access to some features available through the Service.
policy.11: Use of third-party websites and software
policy.11.1: Our Service may contain links to third party websites. Any access to and use of such third-party websites is not governed by this Privacy Policy but is instead governed by the privacy policies of those third-party websites, and we are not responsible for the information practices of such third-party websites.
policy.11.2: All token transactions made through the Interface are facilitated and run through your compatible Ethereum wallet (e.g. MetaMask, a Third-party Extension).
policy.11.3: Certain NFTs (such as Mereo Tickets) are transferred and minted using the Mereo platform (Third-party Platform). Mereo Interface enables access to an Ethereum-based suite of applications (e.g. rewards, claiming, exchange, auctions, sales) allowing users to interact with the smart contracts deployed to the Ethereum blockchain to assist with facilitating token activities.
policy.11.4: By using a Third-party Extension, a Third-party Platform, or any other Third-party services to access our Services you agree that you are governed by the terms of service and privacy policy for the applicable Third-party Extension, applicable terms for the Third-party Platform, or the terms and privacy policy of any other Third-party services
policy.11.5: For example, the MetaMask Terms of Service and Privacy Policy are available at metamask.io/terms.html and metamask.io/privacy.html respectively, but may be updated from time to time.
policy.11.6: You acknowledge and agree that Mereo shall not be responsible or liable, directly or indirectly, for any damage or loss caused or alleged to be caused by or in connection with the use of or reliance on any such third-party content, goods or services available on or through any such web sites or services. We strongly advise you to read the terms and conditions and privacy policies of any third-party web sites or services that you visit.
policy.12.1: If you have concerns about how we or Mereo has handled your Personal Information, you can contact Mereo using the details below. Please include your name, email address and clearly describe your complaint. Mereo will acknowledge your complaint and respond to you within a reasonable period. If you think Mereo has failed to resolve the complaint satisfactorily we will provide you with information about further steps you can take. You also have the right to contact your local data protection authority.
policy.13.1: Personal Data for the purposes of the GDPR means any information relating to You such as a name, an identification number, location data, online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity.
policy.13.2: Mereo generally collects your Personal Data directly from where you are based and may store it on servers outside the EU or the European Economic Area (EEA) in countries such as Australia or the USA, where data protection standards may be lower than in the EU/EEA.
policy.13.3: If you are within the EU you have the right under the GDPR to:
policy.13.3.1: Access, correct, update or erase the information we have on you.
policy.13.3.2: Object to processing of your Personal Data: This right exists where we are relying on a legitimate interest as the legal basis for our processing and there is something about your particular situation that makes you want to object to our processing of your Personal Data.
policy.13.3.3: Request the transfer of Your Personal Data: We will provide to you, or to a third-party you have chosen, your Personal Data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format. Please note that this right only applies to automated information which you initially provided consent for us to use or where We used the information to perform a contract with you.ction
policy.13.3.4: Withdraw Your consent: You have the right to withdraw Your consent on using your Personal Data. If You withdraw Your consent, We may not be able to provide You with access to certain specific functionalities of the Service.
policy.13.4: Exercising Your GDPR Data Protection Rights:
policy.13.4.1: You may exercise Your rights of access, rectification, cancellation and opposition by contacting us by using the information above. From time to time, Mereo may not be able to provide you with access to all of your Personal Information and, where this is the case, we will tell you why. We may also need to verify your identity when you request your Personal Information. If you think that any Personal Data we hold about you is inaccurate, please contact Mereo and we will take reasonable steps to ensure that it is corrected. You have the right to complain to a Data Protection Authority about our collection and use of your Personal Data. For more information, if you are in the European Economic Area (EEA), please contact your local data protection authority in the EEA.
policy.14.1: This privacy notice section for California residents supplements the information contained in Our Privacy Policy and it applies solely to all visitors, users, and others who reside in the State of California, unless otherwise stated that it applies to United States residents generally.
policy.14.2: Personal Information for the purpose of the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) means any information that identifies, relates to, describes or is capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with You. Under CCPA, personal information does not include: Publicly available information from government records, deidentified or aggregated consumer information, information excluded from the CCPA’s scope, such as health or medical information covered by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) and the California Confidentiality of Medical Information Act (CMIA) or clinical trial data Personal Information covered by certain sector-specific privacy laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FRCA), the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA) or California Financial Information Privacy Act (FIPA), and the Driver’s Privacy Protection Act of 1994.
policy.14.3: Business for the purpose of the CCPA refers to Mereo as the legal entity that collects Consumers’ Personal Information and determines the purposes and means of the processing of Consumers’ Personal Information, or on behalf of which such information is collected and that alone, or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of consumers’ Personal Information, that does business in the State of California.
policy.14.4: Consumer for the purpose of the CCPA means a natural person who is a California resident. A resident, as defined in the law, includes (1) every individual who is in California for other than a temporary or transitory purpose, and (2) every individual who is domiciled in the California who is outside California for a temporary or transitory purpose.
policy.14.5: Do Not Track (DNT) is a concept that has been promoted by US regulatory authorities, in particular the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC), for the Internet industry to develop and implement a mechanism for allowing internet users to control the tracking of their online activities across websites. Provisions regarding Do Not Track references herein apply to all residents of the United States.
policy.14.6: Sale, for the purpose of the CCPA (California Consumer Privacy Act), means selling, renting, releasing, disclosing, disseminating, making available, transferring, or otherwise communicating orally, in writing, or by electronic or other means, a Consumer’s personal information to another business or a third party for monetary or other valuable consideration.
policy.14.7.1: We obtain the Personal information listed above from the following categories of sources:
policy.14.7.1.1: Directly from You, for example, from the forms You complete on our Service, preferences You express or provide through our Service, or from Your purchases on our Service;
policy.14.7.2: Indirectly from You, for example, from observing Your activity on our Service;
policy.14.7.3: Automatically from You, for example, through cookies We or our Third Party Service Providers set on Your Device as You navigate through our Service; and
policy.14.7.4: From Third-Party Service Providers, for example, we may use Third-Party services monitor and analyse the use of our Service, to handle payment processing, or to otherwise provide the Services to You.
policy.14.8: Use of Personal Information for Business Purposes or Commercial Purposes:
policy.14.8.1: We may use or disclose personal information We collect for “business purposes” or “commercial purposes” (as defined under the CCPA) as described herein this Privacy Policy and as described to You when collecting Your personal information or as otherwise set forth in the CCPA.
policy.14.9.1: We may share Your Personal Information to the entities We have described herein this Privacy Policy, including but not limited to the entities listed above in the “Disclosure of Personal Information” section of this Privacy Policy.
policy.14.10: Disclosure of Personal Information for Business Purposes or Commercial Purposes:
policy.14.10.1: We may use or disclose the following categories of personal information for business or commercial purposes:
policy.14.10.1.2: Category B: Personal information categories listed in the California Customer Records statute (Cal. Civ. Code § 1798.80(e));
policy.14.10.1.3: Category C: Protected classification characteristics under California or federal law;
policy.14.10.1.5: Category F: Internet or other similar network activity
policy.14.10.2: Please note that the categories listed above are those defined in the CCPA. This does not mean that all examples of that category of personal information were in fact disclosed, but reflects our good faith belief to the best of our knowledge that some of that information from the applicable category may be and may have been disclosed.
policy.14.11: When we disclose personal information for a business purpose or a commercial purpose, we enter a contract that describes the purpose and requires the recipient to both keep that personal information confidential and not use it for any purpose except performing the contract.
policy.14.12.1: The CCPA provides California residents with specific rights regarding their personal information. If You are a resident of California, You have the following rights:
policy.14.13.1: You have the right to be notified which categories of Personal Data are being collected and the purposes for which the Personal Data is being used.
policy.14.14.1: Under CCPA, You have the right to request that We disclose information to You about Our collection, use, sale, disclosure for business purposes and share of personal information. Once We receive and confirm Your request, We will disclose to You:
policy.14.14.1.1: the categories of personal information We collected about You;
policy.14.14.1.2: the categories of sources for the personal information We collected about You;
policy.14.14.1.3: our business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling that personal information;
policy.14.14.1.4: the categories of third parties with whom We share that personal information;
policy.14.14.1.5: the specific pieces of personal information We collected about You;
policy.14.14.1.6: the categories of Personal Information we disclosed.
policy.14.15: The right to delete Personal Data:
policy.14.15.1: You have the right to request the deletion of Your Personal Data, subject to certain exceptions. Once we receive and confirm Your request, we or Mereo Data Representative as applicable will delete (and direct our third party service providers to delete) Your personal information from our records, unless an exception applies.Mereo Data Representatives as applicable may deny Your deletion request if retaining the information is necessary for us or our third party service providers to:
policy.14.15.1.1: complete the transaction for which We collected the personal information, provide a good or service that You requested, take actions reasonably anticipated within the context of our ongoing business relationship with You, or otherwise perform our contract with You;
policy.14.15.1.2: detect security incidents, protect against malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity, or prosecute those responsible for such activities;
policy.14.15.1.3: debug products to identify and repair errors that impair existing intended functionality.
policy.14.15.1.4: exercise free speech, ensure the right of another consumer to exercise their free speech rights, or exercise another right provided for by law;
policy.14.15.1.5: comply with the California Electronic Communications Privacy Act (Cal. Penal Code § 1546 et. seq.);
policy.14.15.1.6: engage in public or peer-reviewed scientific, historical, or statistical research in the public interest that adheres to all other applicable ethics and privacy laws, when the information’s deletion may likely render impossible or seriously impair the research’s achievement, if You previously provided informed consent;
policy.14.15.1.7: enable solely internal uses that are reasonably aligned with consumer expectations based on Your relationship with Us;
policy.14.15.1.8: comply with a legal obligation; and
policy.14.15.1.9: make other internal and lawful uses of that information that are compatible with the context in which You provided it.
policy.14.16: The right not to be discriminated against:
policy.14.16.1: You have the right not to be discriminated against for exercising any of Your consumer’s rights, including by:
policy.14.16.1.1: denying goods or Services or Mereo Activities to You;
policy.14.16.1.2: charging different prices or rates for goods or Services or Mereo Activities, including the use of discounts or other benefits or imposing penalties;
policy.14.16.1.3: providing a different level or quality of goods or Services or Mereo Activities to You; and
policy.14.16.1.4: suggesting that You will receive a different price or rate for goods or Services or a different level or quality of goods or Services or Mereo Activities.
policy.14.16.1.5: Exercising Your CCPA Data Protection Rights:
policy.14.17: California residents may make a request pursuant to your rights under the CCPA by contacting us at team@mereo.xyz.
policy.14.18: Only You, or a person registered with the California Secretary of State that You authorise to act on Your behalf, may make a verifiable request related to Your personal information.
policy.14.19.1: provide sufficient information that allows Us to reasonably verify You are the person about whom we collected personal information or an authorised representative; and
policy.14.19.2: describe Your request with sufficient detail that allows Us to properly understand, evaluate, and respond to it,
policy.14.20: Mereo cannot respond to Your request or provide You with the required information if we cannot verify Your identity or authority to make the request and confirm that the personal information relates to You. We will disclose and deliver the required information free of charge within 45 days of receiving Your verifiable request. The time period to provide the required information may be extended once by an additional 45 days when reasonably necessary and with prior notice. Any disclosures we provide will only cover the 12-month period preceding the verifiable request’s receipt. For data portability requests, we will select a format to provide Your personal information that is readily useable and should allow You to transmit the information from one entity to another entity without hindrance.
policy.14.21: “Do Not Track” Policy as Required by California Online Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA):
policy.14.21.1: Our Service does not respond to Do Not Track signals.
policy.14.22.1: Our Service does not address anyone under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 13. If You are a parent or guardian and You are aware that Your child has provided Us with Personal Data, please contact Us. If We become aware that We have collected Personal Data from anyone under the age of 13 without verification of parental consent, We take steps to remove that information from Our servers. If We need to rely on consent as a legal basis for processing Your information and Your country requires consent from a parent, We may require Your parent’s consent before We collect and use that information.
policy.14.23: Your California Privacy Rights (California’s Shine the Light law):
policy.14.23.1: Under California Civil Code Section 1798 (California’s Shine the Light law), California residents with an established business relationship with us can request information once a year about sharing their Personal Data with third parties for the third parties’ direct marketing purposes. If you’d like to request more information under the California Shine the Light law, and if You are a California resident, You can contact Us using the contact information provided below.
policy.14.24: California Privacy Rights for Minor Users (California Business and Professions Code Section 22581):
policy.14.24.1: California Business and Professions Code section 22581 allows California residents under the age of 18 who are registered users of online sites, services or applications to request and obtain removal of content or information they have publicly posted. To request removal of such data, and if You are a California resident, You can contact Us using the contact information provided below, and include the email address associated with Your account. Be aware that Your request does not guarantee complete or comprehensive removal of content or information posted online and that the law may not permit or require removal in certain circumstances.
